was unsurprised to hear from @intficpics that the extremely excellent Lost Treasures of Infocom disappeared from the iOS app store nearly a decade ago. it was thought to be irretrievably lost.

https://mastodon.gamedev.place/@intficpics/110029921542258418

sooo... I spent a couple of days digging, and located archivist Dan1e31 who had preserved a working copy 🙏

here it is, running like a champ on ye olde iPad. this is an achingly good port of the Lost Treasures titles - each game with complete digital Feelies, Browsies *and* interactive InvisiClues. this is what I consider a labour of love port.

note: this is the free copy with IAPs which appear to still work. Zork I is included - the rest are paywalled. (that being said - if you inspect the app's subdirectories, all of the games are there)

i've uploaded it to IA for permanent archival.

https://archive.org/details/lost-treasures-of-infocom-ios

I've gone all in on the gamification of my 9yo's math facts flash cards. He loves Scratch. So, I built a game in Scratch & got him to be my "video game tester." He also helped with some of the code.

Can you #copyright the texts or images generated by an #AI system? It may depend on how much creativity you develop in order to “select or arrange #AI-generated material in a sufficiently creative way". The question is who will have which #BurdenOfProof. And as most those #AI system are running as a web service, the service provider will always have your prompts and their results. Users are in a weak position!

title: Motorists Break Law To Save Time, Cyclists Break Law To Save Lives, Finds Study

Automattic, the company behind WordPress is now the official author of the ActivityPub plugin. This is pretty big news, since it allows every WordPress website to be a potential fediverse server.

In this piece I take a look at the potential impact on #fediverse culture, zooming in on how tagging your WordPress posts makes them show up when you search for a specific hashtag here on the fediverse.

How do you think this will change the fediverse?

@fediversenews

"The first thing that strikes an observer of the cooperative movement [in the 1980s] is that its participants are young (average age 27.7 years), educated (51% have college degrees, and an additional 34% have some college), and white (93%). In short, the movement is a distinctly white middle-class phenomenon; the low salaries and erratic uncertain career paths exclude, by self-selection, most minorities and all but a handful of those from working-clads origins. This movement is one of the direct successors of the social upheavals of the late 1960s which were largely middle-class based — specifically, the antiwar, university reform, and counterculture movements."

-- "Worker Cooperatives in America", page 94

I'd be really curious to know what the demographics look like today!

@ingrid another submission! honestly i read this sentence & immediately went to write this message, so apologies if there's a better sentence later on. anyway:

"William Carlos Williams once wrote in a letter that he stepped in dogshit on a spring walk in 1921 and was overcome by a desire to learn about French literature."

from https://anneboyer.substack.com/p/100-years-of-spring-and-all

A sociologist reached out to me asking for some examples of bots that include real, physical interactions, in the form of a game or gamified environment.

One particular one that comes to mind is https://botwiki.org/bot/mystery-animal.

There's a few bots under https://botwiki.org/bot/?tags=iot that have a physical component, but not really games per se.

Does anyone know more examples?

#bots #CreativeBots #iot #games

title: How boto3 impacts the cold start times of your Lambda functions

last_post.content:
This was a really helpful geeky read for me this week: https://www.tecracer.com/blog/2021/02/how-boto3-impacts-the-cold-start-times-of-your-lambda-functions.html

Basically, make sure that you give user-facing AWS lambda functions that use boto3 a good amount of memory or they will load really slowly.

title: Decentralized Social Media Rises as Twitter Melts Down

last_post.content:
The rise of the Fediverse is only accelerating as companies like Mozilla and WordPress make moves to support it. Even Meta is rumored to be working on a decentralized social network.

But there's one particular start-up that seems determined to go its own way.

I spoke with @tchambers and @evan about what's driving the Fediverse migration - and the obstacles that can thwart some would-be users.

https://spectrum.ieee.org/mastodon-social-media

#fediverse #mastodon

title: Regulatory Failure 101: What the Collapse of Silicon Valley Bank Reveals

last_post.content:
Regulatory Failure 101: What the Collapse of #SiliconValleyBank Reveals
-
It’s all too familiar: First comes the boom, then the breathtakingly speedy bust, and then the bailout. Now we’re in the moment where everyone wonders where the financial regulators were.

"Primary responsibility for the debacle lies, of course, with #SVB management. But regulators are supposed to grasp that they exist because bankers are always tempted to take risks."

title: Enquête en ESAT : quand l’exploitation des ouvriers passe pour de l'action sociale

last_post.content:
Eh bien non, ce que je vous ai décrit là, se passe en France, en 2023. C'est la situation des 120 000 travailleuses et travailleurs handicapés qui dépendent des 1500 ESAT, les Établissements et Service d'Aide par le Travail.
La France a été plusieurs fois rappelée à l'ordre par l'ONU pour ces pratiques discriminatoires, sans effet et rien n'est fait.
Je vous recommande le billet de Cécile Morin sur le sujet dans le club de Mediapart :
https://blogs.mediapart.fr/morin-cecile/blog/110322/enquete-en-esat-quand-l-exploitation-des-ouvriers-passe-pour-de-laction-sociale
More about the intense stress of living and parenting: https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/all-families-are-not-alike/202303/managing-my-overwhelming-stress
